Class twitter4j.Twitter

The superclass changed from java.lang.Object to twitter4j.TwitterSupport.
Removed interface java.io.Serializable.

Added Methods
boolean existsBlock(String) Tests if a friendship exists between two users.
List<User> getBlockingUsers() Returns a list of user objects that the authenticating user is blocking.
List<User> getBlockingUsers(int) Returns a list of user objects that the authenticating user is blocking.
IDs getBlockingUsersIDs() Returns an array of numeric user ids the authenticating user is blocking.
 

Changed Methods
void forceUsePost(boolean) Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. some methods don't accept POST method anymore
User getAuthenticatedUser() Change in return type from ExtendedUser to User.
 Use verifyCredentials() instead
String getClientURL() Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. @return client URL
String getClientVersion() Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. @return client version
String getPassword() Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. Returns authenticating password
String getSource() Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. Returns the source
String getUserAgent() Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. @return UserAgent
User getUserDetail(String) Change in return type from ExtendedUser to User.
 Returns extended information of a given user, specified by ID or screen name as per the required id parameter below.
String getUserId() Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. Returns authenticating userid
boolean isUsePostForced() Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. @return true if POST is used forcibly
void setClientURL(String) Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. Sets the X-Twitter-Client-URL header.
void setClientVersion(String) Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. Sets the X-Twitter-Client-Version header.
void setHttpConnectionTimeout(int) Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. Sets a specified timeout value, in milliseconds, to be used when opening a communications link to the Twitter API.
void setHttpProxy(String, int) Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. Enables use of HTTP proxy
void setHttpProxyAuth(String, String) Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. Adds authentication on HTTP proxy
void setHttpReadTimeout(int) Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. Sets the read timeout to a specified timeout, in milliseconds.
void setPassword(String) Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. Sets the password
void setRequestHeader(String, String) Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. Sets the request header name/value combination see Twitter Fan Wiki for detail.
void setRetryCount(int) Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport.  
void setRetryIntervalSecs(int) Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport.  
void setSource(String) Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. Sets X-Twitter-Client http header and the source parameter that will be passed by updating methods.
void setUserAgent(String) Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. Sets the User-Agent header.
void setUserId(String) Method was locally defined, but is now inherited from TwitterSupport. Sets the userid
User updateProfile(String, String, String, String, String) Change in return type from ExtendedUser to User.
 Sets values that users are able to set under the "Account" tab of their settings page.
User updateProfileColors(String, String, String, String, String) Change in return type from ExtendedUser to User.
 Sets one or more hex values that control the color scheme of the authenticating user's profile page on twitter.com.
User verifyCredentials() Change in return type from ExtendedUser to User.
 Returns an HTTP 200 OK response code and a representation of the requesting user if authentication was successful; returns a 401 status code and an error message if not.
